meanings.definition: A ruler or other person who holds absolute power, typically one who exercises it in a cruel or oppressive way.
meanings.sent1: The despots in the ancient kingdom ruled with cruelty and oppression.
meanings.sent2: The despots of history are often remembered for their harsh rule.
meanings.sent3: The despots at the party insisted on controlling the music playlist.
meanings.sent4: The despots of time dictate the fate of nations.
meanings.sent5: The despots' iron grip on the land struck fear into the hearts of the people.

meanings.definition: A person who wields power oppressively; a tyrant.
meanings.sent1: The despots of the schoolyard bullied others to show their power.
meanings.sent2: The despots of the workplace made life difficult for their employees.
meanings.sent3: The despots of the kitchen hoarded all the snacks for themselves.
meanings.sent4: The despots of fashion dictate what is trendy and what is not.
meanings.sent5: The despots' influence over the town was undeniable and feared by all.
